intro: Casearia lifuana, commonly known as the Lifuana casearia, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to yellowish flowers. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when mature. Casearia lifuana is often found in moist, shaded habitats within the rainforests of Madagascar.
